wikipedia_page.main: EQ Nicholson  (4 November 1908 – 7 September 1992) was an English painter and textile designer.

response: *7 September – EQ Nicholson, English textile designer and painter (b.1908).

Undeterred by the failure of the Boars Hill shop, in the 1940s she ran a business in Motcomb Street, London. Her designs influenced her sister-in-law EQ Nicholson.The Nicholsons: A Story of Four People and their Designs, p. 56. Her work was exhibited at the Victoria and Albert Museum in 1976.
The designer EQ Nicholson was his daughter.
* November 4 – EQ Nicholson, born Elsie Q. Myers, English textile designer and painter (d. 1992).

After his return to Britain in 1927 he undertook several small architectural commissions. From 1929 to 1930 he taught at the School of Architecture, University of Cambridge; one of his pupils was Hugh Casson. Nicholson moved to London in 1931, and worked for Watson Hart and Val Myer. In December 1931 Nicholson married Elsie Queen Myers, usually known as EQ Nicholson, whom he had met in about 1930.
